intro: Centaurea holargyrea, commonly known as the silver centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Centaurea holargyrea is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its historical use in herbal medicine.
